p: For the in-vitro tests for T. cruzi, CL-B5 clone was used ( 20). The parasites stably transected with the gene for β-galactosidase of Escherichia coli ( lacZ) were provided by Dr. F. Buckner through Commemorative Gorgas Institute (Panama). Epimastigotes forms were cultured at 28 °C in Liver Infusion Tryptose Broth (Difco, Detroit, MI) supplemented with 10% Fetal Bovine Serum (FBS) (Gibco, Carlsbad, CA), penicillin (Ern, SA, Barcelona, Spain) and streptomycin (Reig Jofr SA, Barcelona, Spain) as described by Le Senne et al., ( 21). The cells were collected for testing in the exponential phase of growth.
